frame.name: Set_of_interrelated_entities
frame.definition:
<def-root>A group of <fen>Component_entities</fen> along with their interrelations is viewed as a <fen>Complex</fen>.
<ex>By definition, no external forces act upon an <fex name="des">isolated</fex> <fex name="plx"><t>system</t></fex> <fex name="com">of particles</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="plx">Earth</fex> <m>is</m> a <fex name="des">contained</fex> <t>system</t> <fex name="des">which receives energy from the sun</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Component_entities
FE.definition:
<def-root>The entities that function together as a unit.
<ex>How could consciousness arise in a <t>system</t> <fex name="com">of matter</fex>?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Complex
FE.definition:
<def-root>The unit formed by the <fen>Component_entities</fen>.
<ex>An open <fex name="plx"><t>system</t></fex> is any distinct entity -- a cell, a person, a forest, or an orchestra organization -- that takes in resources from its environment, processes them in some way, and produces output.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any characterization or evaluation of the <fen>Complex</fen>.
<ex>Because the earth is a <fex name="des">closed</fex> <t>system</t>, disposing of products at the end of their useful life can waste usable materials.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Possessor
FE.definition: <def-root>A person or organization that possesses or owns the <fen>Complex</fen> or a larger entity of which the <fen>Complex</fen> itself is a part. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: system.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a group of independent but interacting elements conceived of as a unified whole
